column1: Beautiful Soup Documentation¶
Beautiful Soup is a
Python library for pulling data out of HTML and XML files. It works
with your favorite parser to provide idiomatic ways of navigating
searching
column2: and modifying the parse tree. It commonly saves programmers

column1: hours or days of work.
These instructions illustrate all major features of Beautiful Soup 4
with examples. I show you what the library is good for
how to use it
column2: how to make it do what you want
column3: and what to do when it

column1: violates your expectations.
This document covers Beautiful Soup version 4.9.3. The examples in
this documentation should work the same way in Python 2.7 and Python
You might be looking for the documentation for Beautiful Soup 3.
If so
column2: you should know that Beautiful Soup 3 is no longer being

column1: developed and that support for it will be dropped on or after December

column2: 2020. If you want to learn about the differences between Beautiful

column1: Soup 3 and Beautiful Soup 4

send mail to the discussion group. If
